elements.title: William Penn Memorial Fire Tower (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the William Penn Memorial Fire Tower (pictured) overlooking Reading, Pennsylvania, was built during the Great Depression with funding from the Works Progress Administration?

elements.title: Martin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hong Kong YouTuber Martin co-created a video showing himself using a washing machine to make soup?

elements.title: a decoration for women (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sudan has a decoration for women, with a pink ribbon, and another for men, with a green ribbon?

elements.title: Michael Lipton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that developmental economist Michael Lipton showed that poor farmers were more resource efficient than rich farmers?

elements.title: Square (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Japanese game developer Square was told to "never come back" by Nintendo after shifting production to the PlayStation?

elements.title: Rick Suder (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rick Suder was bumped from the NCAA record book by JJ Redick and Gerry McNamara?

elements.title: Omar Menéndez (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in February 2023, Ecuadorian entrepreneur Omar Menéndez was elected the mayor of his canton the day after his assassination?

elements.title: an Arkansas TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the 1980s, "Sherman Bonner, The Human Thermometer" presented the weather on an Arkansas TV station?
